Subsection.Text: The Department of Children and Family Services, the Department of Education, the Department of Corrections, and the Department of Law Enforcement each shall appoint a policy level staff person to serve as the agency substance abuse impairment coordinator. The responsibilities of the agency coordinator include interagency and intraagency coordination, collection and dissemination of agency-specific data relating to substance abuse impairment, and participation in the development of the state comprehensive plan for substance abuse impairment.

The department shall establish, within each of its substate entities, the full-time position of substance abuse impairment prevention coordinator, to be filled by a person with expertise in the area of substance abuse impairment. The primary responsibility of this person is to develop and implement activities which foster the prevention of substance abuse impairment.
